Timeline
TIMELINE TECHNOLOGY CONSEQUENCES INTERVIEW
➤
The Side-Handled Baton More Technology 911 Better Armor TASERs Pepper Spray Popular Weapon DNA Forensics Mostly Computerized Loud LRADs Gunshot Location
The Side-Handled Baton - 1958
A former marine invents the side-handled baton, which is more effective for many officers than the original baton, which was basically a glorified club.
More Technology - 1967
The Presidents Commission on Law Enforcement and Administrative Justice finds that while many police departments have made good use of their new-found technology, most of it could have been adopted about 30 years earlier.
Call 911! - 1968
911 invented. In the years following it spreads into universal use, but at first is only used by several cities.
Better Armor - 1972
The National Institute of Justice begins development of a lightweight body armor made from kevlar.
TASERs - 1974
the TASER is developed in its first incarnation, but is classified as a firearm due to its use of gunpowder in 1976.
Pepper Spray - 1982
Pepper spray, also known as OC spray, after the compound it is composed of, is developed.
Popular Weapon - 1985
Police in every state are using TASERs, a useful non-lethal weapon if used correctly.
DNA Forensics - 1986
DNA evidence used to prove that Richard Buckland didn’t commit two murders, and is later used to prove that the murders were committed by Colin Pitchfork. It is the first use of such evidence
Mostly Computerized - 1993
About 90% of large police departments use computers.
Loud LRADs - 2005
First use of the LRAD, a device used to disperse crowds and to provide a means to speak over several communicators is first used to foiled a pirate attack on a cruise ship off the Somali coast.
Gunshot Location - 2006
The ShotSpotter gunshot locater is first installed. It is installed in Oakland, and provided local police with ability to precisely locate gunshots, as well as the ability to get to start rushing to the scene the instant the shot is fired.
➤

On this page, you can view a comprehensive timeline of the major advances in police technology since 1950. To use it, simply click on the event in the left column that you would like to view.
